Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2007 07:50PM grapelady4 wrote: Hi, Thank you everyone for your information.  I won't be getting my results until Monday now.  Thought I would add that I have had numerous lumps and bumps in my right breast and have had them all checked out...they were all fine.  This thickening on the left breast is much different, kind of longish, hard and does not move around.  As well I am on ERT due to full hysterecomy 6 years ago.  I have already decided that regardless of the results of the test, I am going to ask to see a surgeon.  I just have a feeling in my gut that something is not right.  Learned though past health issues, that you are in charge of your own health.  Wondering what everyone went through before diagnosis.  I am an info junkie about anything....the more info the better, though I do realize every situation is different. Thanks again!!!!!! for your info and support.
Posts.Title: dr found thickening of left boob grapelady4 nash

Posts.Content: grapelady4 wrote: Hi, I am 43 yrs old, mother had BC @59, she is a survivor. 2 weeks ago I found a lum/thickening on my left breast 10:00.  Went to GP who felt it saying"I feel thickening of the breast, we need to get it checked out".  I was hoping he was going to say it's nothing to worry about....so I worried.  He sent me for a diagnostic mammo and ultra sound today.  Don't have any results as of yet, but the radiologist at the ultrasound, said she couldn't find anything and had to ask me twice where the thickening was.  The Mammo gal, had felt it right away.  I am now playing the hurry up and wait and feeling confused.  Anyone else ever had thickening?  If nothing on ultrasound am I out of the woods?  Might get results on Friday aft, but more likely on Monday.  If I can make it through the weekend without going out of my mind.   Thanks!!!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: dr found thickening of left boob grapelady4 nash
